english: to move; movement; to stir/touch; to set in motion

etymology.description: semantic: 力 (“strength”) + phonetic: 重; simplified from 動 (重 → 云).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of strength (力) with the heavy/weighty phonetic 重, evoking exerting force to move something substantial. In simplification, 重 was reduced to 云 for ease of writing, while the semantic cue 力 still signals physical action and the phonetic link became less transparent.
etymology.simplification: 重 was replaced by 云 to reduce stroke count and regularize the component across several simplified forms; semantics via 力 were preserved but the phonetic cue weakened.

examples.chinese: 请不要随便动我的电脑(請不要隨便動我的電腦)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng búyào suíbiàn dòng wǒ de diànnǎo.
examples.english: Please don’t casually touch/move my computer.

examples.chinese: 风一吹，窗帘就动了(風一吹，窗簾就動了)。
examples.pinyin: Fēng yī chuī, chuānglián jiù dòng le.
examples.english: When the wind blows, the curtains start to move.

examples.chinese: 这部电影太感人了，把我都感动了(這部電影太感人了，把我都感動了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng tài gǎnrén le, bǎ wǒ dōu gǎndòng le.
examples.english: This movie was so touching it moved me emotionally.
